Great value for money and the scent is fresh and light, a great go to beauty essential in my bathroom cupboard. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

A miracle in a bottle! Absolutely love this product! I suffer with dry sensitive skin and vaseline is one of very few products that doesn't make my skin flare up and itch like crazy!The first thing I noticed was the beautiful fresh smell that escaped as I lifted the cap, as I applied a drop to my skin I instantly felt a soothing relief and easily moisturised into my skin absorbing effortlessly and not at all greasy unlike alot of other moisturisers I've tried! I use this product every day and it has improved my dry skin condition massively couldn't recommend this product enough I absolutely love it! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

Lingering, comforting smell and cleans really well Absolutely love this stuff ... leaves a lovely lingering fragrance that you can smell each time you open a wardrobe or clothes drawer ... gets everything clean really well too Reminds me of when I was a kid and Mum just put me in some freshly laundered clothes ... lovely

Perfect for cashmere sweaters and silk tops I love that I now wash my cashmere sweaters at home. Saves me a lot of money compared to taking my clothes to the dry-cleaners every week. Very happy with my purchase

Skin so soft.. highly recommend! So prior to receiving this I had pretty rough elbows in particular and my skin feels dry. As a busy mum of two I admit I sometimes neglect myself.. some of you may empathise! But this product trial gave me the perfect opportunity to reconnect with myself and have a bit of \u201Cme time\u201D. So for 3 days after my baths / shower I smothered myself with this. I must admit the first time I put this on I wasn\u2019t sure about the smell. It\u2019s not offensive it\u2019s like a cucumber smell (although it\u2019s aloe) but I tend to smell of perfumes all the time.. however by day 3 I actually liked the smell. Application: it went on nicely not too thick and soaked in pretty quickly it didn\u2019t feel sticky. I always have my morning wash by 07:30 but even in the evening before bedtime my skin is feeling noticibly softer and my rough elbows gone. Verdict: thumbs up. Yes I will be continuing to use this thank you for a fab product trial and for introducing me to Vaseline Aloe! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

Best Make-up remover product Have used a lot of make-up brands and in the past bought their more expensive make-up remover products, but none have ever removed mascara, eye-shadow, foundation bases etc as gently and as well as Simple Cleansing Lotion. Its consistency is not runny, you have to squeeze the bottle appropriately onto the cotton wool, which is ideal for controlling how much is dispensed. Also great for tidying up eyeliner or mascara errors when applied sparsely on a cotton wool bud. Always keep this now in my bathroom cabinet. Why pay more?

Good if you have sensitive skin This is a good deodorant if you have easily irritated skin. It's like Dove soap in that it doesn't seem to irritate or dry out skin. I've used Dove soaps for quite a long time and this is certainly something which they are good for, this seems to be as good as all of them. It's main selling point, beyond being an effective 24 hour deodorant, is that it is not prone to marking your clothes. It certainly seems to work as far as that goes too, though we haven't been able to test on every single colour. Good though. Recommended.

A good product The cream is very easy to apply and feels extremly cooling. It doesnt dry with any kind of sticky feeling to it. There is very little or no scent to it so the fact the the frangrance is fairly neutral is good. The cream spread and soaks in very easily [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

Beautiful product Execellent product, made my skin feel silky smooth and extremely hydrated. Used it for a couple of weeks and my skin felt healthier, more hydrated and overall looked better. Would definitely recommend this product to a friend. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

Smooth, clear skin This cream is light, odourless and leaves the skin feeling genuinely smooth, supple and refreshed. I use it as part of my nightly routine - applying it when going to bed after washing and drying my face. It is light enough not to clog the pores or feel sticky on the face, and in the morning my face always feels smooth and replenished. I have also tried using this cream during the daytime and, while it has all the benefits described above, it\u2019s not long-lasting enough in terms of the hydration it gives, meaning you often feel the need to reapply after a few hours. All in all a great overnight moisturiser if you have sensitive skin - it\u2019s unscented and it\u2019s really gentle on sore patches. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

A perfect winter drink We all crave things that transport us back to more innocent times. For me Bovril is one of those things, from the gooey unctuousness of the tar black bovril overflowing from the spoon to the "ding ding ding" as I stir it in hot water to make it dissolve and the earthy, beefy smell with hints of celery and goodness knows what else. Sometimes you can get alcohol fatigue so Bovril is a great alternative to a nightcap or even mug of tea. I even go so far as to dissolve a pat of butter in it too for extra richness and within an hour I'm pretty much knocked out and sleep soundly until morning, warm and comforted. This pack will last me a long time I am sure, certainly 2 winters.

Gorgeous shower cream, no SLS! I usually buy organic cosmetics and wanted a natural product without the high price tag. I was delighted to find this! It is silky smooth, thick and creamy, gentle on the skin, and rich enough to moisturise my dry mature skin. It has a gorgeous delicate fragrance and feels far more expensive than it is. shame about the bottle! The mayonnaise would get 5 stars from me for taste but the container is style over substance. The squeezy bottle is, in itself, a genius idea but thats where it stops. The cap is made of brittle plastic so it shatters as it hits the kitchen floor. Its like Groundhog Day each time it happens! Lovely gel moisturiser I do like the Simple brand products as I have sensitive skin and I need to be really careful with chemicals. This Simple Face Moisturiser moisturiser is fantastic. The moisturiser applies well to the skin and sinks in quickly leaving my skin feeling refreshed and moisturised with no heaviness or stickiness. I had no reaction to this moisturiser at all. I have a combination skin and this moisturiser was ideal as it has no greasiness. After a few hours of wearing I find that my skin feels totally normal, there is no greasiness at all which I sometimes get with creamy moisturisers. Also I found that I could apply makeup easily within a short period of time as the moisturiser sunk into my skin easily. I have light wrinkles and although the moisturiser can not perform miracles it did prevent my skin from drying over the day from the effects of heating or the sun. I think that this is one of the best moisturisers that I have used. It does the job with no side effects.

have been using for years, works well on all my silk, wool and linen items I have been using this for years and it works really well; it has not damaged any of my clothes. it has not left a residue on any of my clothes. it keeps my clothes in good condition and colour. it has not irritated my sensitive skin in any way. I have been using Persil silk and wool for years and it is really good. I only looked on Amazon as my supermarket had not had any for 3 weeks in a row, and realised it costs about the same here on Amazon Pantry. I wash my silk, wool and linen items on a silk wash ( on my washing machine that is a setting, but I think it comes to the following...30 degrees C, light action, very low spin cycle - very important not to hard spin wool or silk, ruins the fibres) I hang them up to dry. all of these items are either hand wash only or dry clean only items, and quite honestly I do not have the strength to hand wash or the wish to dry clean. This has worked well for me for 10+ years using this detergent.

Smells gorgeous Great product, I used this for the first time after a bath and shaving my legs. The lotion wasn't greasy and left my legs smelling and feeling Fab. Light, non greasy and super moisturising. Winter is really taking its toll on my skin and this moisturiser has been wonderful. It soaks in fast, isn't greasy at all and has a really refreshing aloe scent as well. It does everything I need to and does it well. It's water based so probably not best for oily skin, but on my normal to dry it's doing great. I'm pretty sensitive too but this hasn't caused any problems. However, it also contains Palm Oil. Now, palm oil is a brilliant ingredient and does a lot of wonderful things. But at the moment, it's rarely ethically sourced and that's my only issue with this product. Unilever are a big big player and need to address this issue. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

Leaves skin feeling fresh I have tried this product and was totally impressed with how soft it left my skin. Its refreshing to the touch as well as to smell. I suffer from dry skin and this has made such a difference. I will be using this product all the time from now on. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

Soft skin I tried the Simple hydrating cleansing wipes during the evening to remove my makeup and cleanoses the skin. I found the wipes very soft and easy to use the wipes are nothe too wet or rough with just enough product on them to remove stubborn make up and feel gentle at the same time. Ideal for when you need tone take off makeup in a hurry and handy for traveling. I would recommend for anyone that has sensitive or dry skin. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

I thought it was a really nice chocolate ice cream with plenty of chocolate fish - much more than I expected - but didnt really think there was a lot of caramel or marshmallow content, which was a shame. I would, however, buy this product again.
Mmmm If you want a sweet rich chocolate ice cream, this will hit the spot.

Really good for sensitive skin As a regular user of a number of simple products, I was very impressed with there refreshing shower gel. I suffer with quite dry skin during the winter, and when using other brands of shower gel they can sometimes act harshly and leave my skin quite dry and flaky, especially on my face. However with this simple shower gel this is not the case. It does not irritate my skin in face it leaves my complexion looking clearer and my skin feeling soft. The size of the bottle is adequate for everyday use and regular use. And although the packaging is quite mild it does the job. I would definitely choose this shower gel out of the choice. A little bit goes a long way, and the product has a pleasent scent. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

A gel that will refresh you ! I love having a shower in the morning and moreover, using a really fresh shower gel. This is the first thing I need to have a great day. Definitely getting this from now on and recommending to anyone that has similar issues to me [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

Kind cleansing Suffering from mild Ezyema, my skin has always been sensitive and dry so i'm very careful when using skincare products preferring brands who use no nasties. I've been a fan of Simple for a while now, using their moisturisers and face wipes and have just switched to using their Kind to Skin face wash. 3 weeks in and i've noticed my skin is more radiant and less dry than it has been, with my face left feeling clean and fresh after each wash. It's light, refreshing, non perfumed and best of all kind to skin but still cleansing. A great every day mild cleanser that you can introduce to your skin care regime. A great product at a very affordable price range. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

Lovely and refreshing I usually like a moisturising face wash as I have fairly dry skin but this is lovely to use after a long day. Leaves no residue and left my skin feeling really soft. I need to be careful not to use too much as a little can go along way. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

Gentle and refreshing Having sensitive skin it's usually difficult to find a facial wash that is effective, refreshing, gentle and doesn't dry out my skin. Good and fresh wash I really like this product, I use it in my double cleansing routine, after using oil to remove my makeup, this product helps removing all the rest. I feel that it really respect my acne prone skin and leaves it fresh and smooth. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

Great for every day skin care This product is really surprising! It leaves my face looking and feeling so smooth, soft and fresh! I would certainly recommend this product as part of your every day skin care routine. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

Amazing I use to use shops own brand face wash which seemed to dry my face out and cause spots since trying the simple kind refreshing face wash my face has never felt as soft and no signs of dry skin or spots will definitely be buying this face wash [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

average but wouldn't use again I found that a lot of product was needed to remove eye make up. It made my skin feel quite dry around my eyes after using as well.
a nice mixture of variety A nice mixture of variety you get two of each flavour but its a bit too creamy compared to other brands..

my favourite Low carb, genuine taste and often on offer. Nothing wrong with the bottle....

Extremely good value Persil washing capsules Some things in life are enjoyable to buy and some things plainly are not. No matter how pretty the product and how bright and bold the actual washing detergent is, it will always be a grudge purchase. No one likes to have dirty smelly clothes and wash powder / tablets / capsules are a necessity that makes a hole in everyone's weekly grocery budget that could be better spent on something interesting such as cakes or exotic vegetables that you have to look up how to cook. Along with Ariel, Fairy and Bold, Persil is one of the big brands that dominant the market for detergents. It is owned by global consumer products giant Unilever who are experts at branding and marketing. It is refreshing to see these capsules at such reasonable value., they work out 15p each which is an absolute bargain. Even the dodgy imitation ones you find in sub prime supermarkets are more than these, and the great thing about Persil is that you can guarantee that the product is going to be high quality. These capsules come in a rubbery gossamer coated casing containing a different brightly coloured gel like liquids in each of the four compartments. And very funky they look too with purple, green, white and grey swirls of gu. These things wash your clothes nicely too and have a pleasant smell without being too overbearing. I have no idea what happens to the plasticated casing on the outside of the capsule after you put in in the washing machine. Maybe it bio-de-grades, maybe it disappears by magic, this is one of lives great mysteries like the Great Sphinx at Giza, the Bermuda Triangle or the meaning of the Voynich Manuscript.
Good buy. Please wash really well and there is no residue left in the drum. Washing comes out clean and smelling fresh.
Clothes are clean and Smell nice Happy with purchasing this product in bulk, cheaper than picking it up from the supermarket. Did not find any residue after the wash.
nice product as described
ok it clean well
Great value Second time ordering these. Bargain pack means it works out the same per capsule as a shops own brand! Clean the clothes well. Will definitely reorder again
Great value for money Product as described. Arrived on time and great value for money .
Practical purchase Great bulk buy obviously you need space but it's something that you use and need
Good buy. Please wash really well and there is no residue left in the drum. Washing comes out clean and smelling fresh.
Clothes are clean and Smell nice Happy with purchasing this product in bulk, cheaper than picking it up from the supermarket. Did not find any residue after the wash.
nice product as described
ok it clean well

Amazing value Great product says what it does on the tin

Better value As expected. Better value than supermarket.
Great value compare to any supermarket Washes well
Great value for money Quick delivery, good value

What Happened to My Old Faithful?!? I have used Vaseline on my lips for well over 20 years and loved it. I buy a large jar of plain Vaseline and use on my lips. I loved that there is really no smell or taste to it. BUT last week, I bought a new jar, put some on, and it has a taste that I can only explain of tasting like black oil that goes into a car. Essential Go to treatment Time after time I return to this product. While it is designed probably for younger skin I am in my 50's with menopausal skin which is sometimes irritated and find that this cream helps to calm down excema , redness etc. On its own it does not reduce the wrinkles and crepey skin that come with aging but when layered and used in conjunction with hyaluronic based creams that are water based it makes a wonderful companion and does a good job of making my eyes look reasonable and ironing out some of the wrinkles and loss of firmness. It is easily absorbed , doesn't leave greasy skin so is great under make up. Can be used with day or night eye creams. Best of all it's a good price.

Great but extortionate price Helped my scalp so much but the price is ridiculous when you consider the amount you have to use per wash and that you must buy the conditioner too. Any other non gentle brand would last me 4 times longer than this. It feels like people with illness are being rinsed (no pun intended). It's a no go for really long hair. I will be looking into other cheaper alternatives but the product is great. It's helped with my husbands dermatitis and with my sore scalp. At first my hair went dry and was like hay, then it was switching back and forth from dry to greasy but after a few weeks it's looking healthier than ever. I'm wondering if it just takes time for your hair to get used to less stuff on it and to get back to more of its natural form if you know what I mean.My main advice would be to try it for 6 weeks minimum before you write it off as rubbish.My only other annoyance aside from the price is that it's very thin and runny. It's hard to stop it running down my hair then off down my back so 20% of the bottle just goes down the plug hole without ever washing my hair first.

Lovely wash, packaging isnt childproof!! I used to only every purchase Fairy non bio liquid as my husband suffers with eczema and is extremely sensitive. I would have never purchased anything else but my brother said try Persil non bio its great for my nephews sensitive skin. He gave me some of his and I randomly washed clothes and bedding in Persil, as I didnt want my husband to say he had a flare down to the change. He didnt, result for me because I love the fresh smell. I have also noticed and difference in the brightness of my whites and clothes are so soft. I live in a hard water area and the results are great. The capsules are so convenient and perform great with only one, because I am very heavy handed and fill the washing balls up, so I am also saving money with these. I am now a subscriber so dont have to worry about running out :) I do wish they wasnt so attractive on the eye because they do look edible. Please keep out of reach of children because the packaging isnt child proof!!!

Smell pleasant, wash well I tried these as Im fed up of powder and conditioner leaving a mess in the washing machine drawer and also taking up loads of space in the cupboards. Wed tried another brand however they werent perfumed and the other half likes his laundry to have a fragrance to it - personal preference. So I shopped around to find a cheap but known brand and found these in subscribe and save. Were using them every few days and can say we are quite happy with them. They smell nice but not over powering, leave no residue in the drum or on clothes, come in refill packs so I can top up my container and then the bin isnt full of powder boxes and they are easy to use as theres no question over how much to use. Also as a plus, they dont seem to bleach clothing as I found happened occasionally when using powder that got stuck in clothing and not rinsed out properly. If these stay at a good price then I will continue to buy as Im very happy with them.

Comfort Intense Laundry Conditioner Liquid Our household normally use comfort, however I hadn't used the 'Fresh Sky' scent before, which I must say is really nice! Just don't go sniffing directly from the bottle as it's concentrated, the scent is much more intense that it really is. The ultra concentrated allows for a much smaller bottle and you don't need to use as much in the washing machine either (just half a lid worth); the smaller bottle of course makes the carbon footprint smaller; in addition, the bottle is made from 100% recycled plastic which is a bonus, and both the bottle and lid can be recycled back. Only downside is the sleeve isn't, so do make sure you remove this before throwing the bottle in the recycling; hopefully they will work on making the whole thing recyclable in the future. All in all, good value for money and great scent (though the latter is subjective).

Great for sensitive skin My wife has extremely sensitive skin, which I never believed until I inadvertently washed some of her clothing in a different detergent. On that basis, she has used either Persil or Fairy products for our joint laundry for many years. Combine that with the fact that we cannot use biological products as we have a septic tank, this product is ideal. The detergent is dispensed into a capsule which is inserted into the main body of the product and then placed on top of the laundry. There is sufficient detergent for 48 washes from the two bottles. The detergent is complimented by a fabric conditioner, which is measured out into the fabric compartment softener on the washing machine; there is sufficient to condition 24 washes. Both products have a pleasant "clean" fragrance and leave clothing smelling fresh and soft after drying. A really good product for those with sensitive skin and competitively priced against normal supermarket prices.

Persil and Comfort Sensitive Kit In this "kit" for sensitive skin you get x2 Persil non-biological washing detergent (potentially 48 washes) and x1 ultra-concentrate Comfort Pure (potentially 38 washes). I say potentially because if you are doing larger loads you'll need to increase the amount you use. We tend to alternate between Fairy and Persil non-bio, not only because we have young children but also because some family members have sensitive skin. We've never had an issue with someone having a reaction due to Persil, it's probably our preferred brand. We don't use Comfort Pure all the time because some members of the family don't like how it leaves their clothes feeling (too soft!), but we do use it on the children's clothes because it leaves them nice and soft. Both products in this kit are endorsed by the British Skin Foundation. Price for the kit at the time of writing the review is £11, this is slightly more than you would currently get the individual products in some supermarkets (£3 for each product). But you are getting them delivered too. If you wanted to give a practical baby shower gift, this would be ideal, slightly different to a nappy pyramid. Would also make a practical house-warming present. Overall - good products that work, slightly on the expensive side.

Simple application and great results! Can't go wrong for the price! I often use this alongside fake tan to sustain the colour and my skin often gets dry after applying fake tan so this helps to keep it hydrated! It's so quick and easy to apply. You can apply either morning or night and leave on - you'll see results quickly! So good to take away on holiday too to give you that extra summer glow and colour that's so easy to do! However... once you've finished applying, make sure you wash your hands or wipe your palms with a wet wipe. Also clean your nails thoroughly as the colour can stick there as you're using your hands to apply. Other than that, really recommends this product and it's such good value for money!

Love this! After being caught out by the sudden nice weather and me still being as pale as an uncooked chip I bought a bottle of this to try. The very first time I used it, I did have a couple of streaks on my legs then I read the instructions and realised it says you must apply it in circles, so the next day I used a liberal amount and made sure to use a circular motion all over and I was delighted that on only the second day I had enough colour to go bare-legged (it had also covered up the streaks too)I have now applied this for 4 days running and look like I have been away for a week in the sun. It is a really natural even colour. There is a bit of a whiff of fake tan when you first apply it but it wears off after a few hours. My skins feels so smooth and moisturised too which is an added bonus!

If you're not a fan of tan, you'll be converted! I've always longed for more of a healthy colour to my skin as I am extremely pale, but have been put off each time I have used a tanning product because- well, it's been disastrous. However! This is the first (and only) successful product that i have used which creates a beautifully even, healthy and natural tan within a few days.I could not rate this enough. I also have sensitive, spot-prone skin on my face but I have been able to use this on my face successfully as well. Long-lasting, deeply moisturising and super natural. 10/10 my favourite!

Smelly Purchased because it was on offer and my blindingly white legs needed a bit of help. I only wanted a gradual tanner because there is less chance of obvious streaks. It smelt nice on application, a light floral scent. However within a few hours it smelt stronger than actual full on fake tan - very unpleasant. I could also feel the cream sitting on my skin, not fully absorbed or dry. The actual tanning result was barely noticeable. I won't be buying again.

Love it, natural looking bronzed glow Love this! I am fair haired, blue eyed, lily white skin older lady who burns to a crisp in the sun, when i uncover. Having just returned from holiday i wanted to at least look like i had a tan but it was very cold there. I bought this on offer and went for Fair - Med. The first time i put it on my arms all over sparingly i didnt really notice that much although there was definately something. Today i thought let me add a bit more after a my usual morning shower. I applied a bit more liberally over arms legs, and face. I have had comments today on what a lovely glow i have. It has developed nicely today. I have a sassy looking healthy bod and i feel good. Bought another tube and just ordered a few more whilst on offer. I hate sitting in the sun and burning (unless i am covered in P20 lotion) and this is a very safe way to get the bronze look. No streaks, easy to apply, doesnt stain hands, slight tan smell but not too much. I am hooked.

Good but a little sticky Really like the light colour this product gives me-easy to use & streak free. However, reading a lot of reviews many claim the lotion dries quickly however this is not my experience. I spend about an hour drying off and am sticky most of the day.

Follow the pouring instructions and you are on a winner! Great fragrance that strikes just the right balance - although the wife complains that the small bottles are very difficult to pour accurately from. They probably are if you slurp in what you reckon is a full measure and, in fact, it is nearer two full measures. This is a really quick way to use up a small 540 ml bottle.but.if you use the cap as a measure as it is supposed to be..then you will find it is a very economical way to use the conditioner! Very cool fragrance which actually carries through to your clothes, making you smell like a Fresh Sky  if you know what such a thing smells like? Something else I really like about this conditioner is that the bottles are all made from recyclable plastic and the manufacturer is asking for customers to recycle the new bottles so they can go the same path third time around! Three Stars for the product and another one for being good and green.

Economical, softens clothes, not as good as dedicated fragrancers if you want a lasting scent Great price for these bottles, and you only need a small amount (half a cap) in the wash to soften clothes. The smell is nice but doesn't last - if you want something that lingers, try Lenor Unstoppables (but that won't soften clothes). That said, the softening effect is noticeable, even when handwashing delicate underwear. I like the ultra concentration which reduces the size of the bottles for storage.

Convenient and effective fabric conditioner This is an ultra concentrated fabric conditioner. I was initially surprised at how small the bottles were but then I read on the side that you only need half a cap of the product so each bottle will last you a while. It is nice to be able to fit the bottles in my kitchen cupboard! I did find that half a cap was enough. I live in an area with very hard water and my clothes came out of the wash feeling soft and smelling lovely. I did really like the scent although it is nothing special (it just had that generic floral fabric conditioner scent that they all have).

Rubbish Bought one of the smaller sized bottles of the same softener to compare quality and was disappointed to find this was much thinner than the kind you find in the shop. Has been heavily diluted so no real saving, will be going back to getting it in the shop and cancelling my subscription.

Great curry taste Love a pot noodle. Plenty of curry flavour. Brill as a snack anytime. Easy to prepare. Great value for money. Cheaper than the supermarkets. Definitely recommend

Comfort Intense Laundry Conditioner Liquid (Fresh Sky) Our household normally use comfort, however I hadn't used the 'Fresh Sky' scent before, which I must say is really nice! Just don't go sniffing directly from the bottle as it's concentrated, the scent is much more intense that it really is. The ultra concentrated allows for a much smaller bottle and you don't need to use as much in the washing machine either (just half a lid worth); the smaller bottle of course makes the carbon footprint smaller; in addition, the bottle is made from 100% recycled plastic which is a bonus, and both the bottle and lid can be recycled back. Only downside is the sleeve isn't, so do make sure you remove this before throwing the bottle in the recycling; hopefully they will work on making the whole thing recyclable in the future. All in all, good value for money and great scent (though the latter is subjective).
Tasty Lovely

Lovely scent This listing is for a pack of 8, concentrated fabric softeners, although I received a sample for review purposes. Note that the container is made from 100% recycled plastic and is suitable for further recycling, but you do need to remove the plastic wrap that holds the product information (once the bottle is used up, as you need it beforehand for dosing information). I found I needed to use a jar opener to remove the lid for the first time; I guess that is good when you are receiving this via the post as it means there is less chance of the lid coming loose and spilling contents into the parcel rather than onto your clothes. I like the scent, which transfers well to laundry and leaves it smelling floral without being overly sweet. It would be worth sniffing in a shop before committing to a large pack however, as not all laundry scents are to everyones taste. The softness is fantastic, particularly noticeable after laundry has been dried outside, which normally makes it feel stiff. A bottle will cover up to 36 loads (4-5 Kg), you will only manage 16 larger, 6-7 Kg loads. The bottle looks small, but the liquid is very concentrated, so do use the dosing cap rather than just pour into the machine as you will otherwise use too much (probably).
my kids love these big Pot noodles! my kids will not spend a whole week without Pot Noodles and this is their favourite flavour. Great big pots, larger than average and at a bargain price on Amazon.

You put the liquid in the soap/conditioner drawer and measure a small amount out in the lid.

My least favourite Magnum If I was a wild-eyed enthusiast and was asked to rate free Magnums as part of a promotion I'd perhaps err on the generous side. As a paying customer, however, these are nothing to write home about. There's an uncomfortable flavour clash, between the dark chocolate coating and the sickly sweet raspberry sauce which covers the core, that's difficult to describe. The core itself reminded me of the cheapest imaginable insipid, own brand raspberry ice-cream with little of the smooth creaminess you find in other Magnums. It's almost as if they rushed the product development process and ended up with bitter raspberry ripple on a stick. So, so disappointing when you consider what these could have been.

Easy to pour as smaller, lighter bottles Because the bottles are smaller and lighter, and I have a touch of stiffness in my hands I find these much easier to pick up and pour them than the traditional larger bottles, although I did have a bit of a struggle getting the lid off the first time. The scent is fresh, floral and pleasant, and not overpowering, and it lingers on washing well afterwards too. The bottles are reasonably good value as a little goes a long way - A half capful is recommended for washes of 4-5 kg, and a full capful for larger washes. There are 36 washes based on the half capful dose for 4-5kg loads, so as I usually do larger loads I should get approximately 18 washes per bottle. The bottle is made from 100% recycled plastic and it can be recycled again, except for the plastic sleeve.

Soft Clothes These are 540ml bottles giving 36 wash loads of Fuchsia Passion fabric conditioner by Comfort. The bottles are entirely plastic, made from 100% recycled plastic and are 100% recyclable. The bottles have a narrow screw top, which is used as the measure, and the bottle has an accurate slim pourer  no dribbles. This one is concentrated and needs only ½ a capful for each washload. I've used Comfort on and off for many years and this Fuchsia Passion fragrance is a very nice, light floral fragrance. My towels and clothing all felt nice and soft after being washed and dried, and had a lovely smell of flowers with a hint of fruit  mango?  and freshly laundered clothing. It's not too strong or overpowering at all  just a nice smell of just washed clothes.

Small but Mighty Clearly this latest product variation from Comfort is to address some environmental concerns and plastics waste. The product is highly concentrated, so comes in a smaller bottle that is itself recycled. Reduced packaging and transport costs. All very commendable. Just how concentrated the product is can be sensed from the fact that you can detect the scent before you even open the bottle. When you do, don't breath deeply (as I did), it's overpowering. However, in it's more dilute form (just half a cap per load), it does add a pleasant, slightly zesty aroma to your clothes. The scent will be a matter of taste, but we like it and our washing feels soft and pleasant (though we were already regular Comfort users). In this form the product represents good value for a quality product and for those who want to lessen their impact on the environment (albeit in the smallest of ways), there's something for you here, too.

The whole bottle bar the wrapper is recyclable. The bottle is small (see picture) but as it is ultra concentrated it still lasts as long as a larger bottle. Highly recommended product.

Relied on for decades this is the best Non Bio I have used this brand forever and love the way it never upsets any skin, especially when washing sheets and items that are next to the body such as jeans, underwear. Ever since I had small babies and now helping with grandchildren, this is the most child-friendly of all the branded washing products. Recommended by the Skin Foundation means you can try any eczema-afflicted skin with this item with confidence. Having the smaller, ultra concentrated Pure Comfort as an extra means you can dish up an extra helping of softness when required. Just a little amount will do the job. Altogether 48 washes from the two handy bottles of Persil's Non-Bio liquid detergent can be carefully measured into the bubble pod, so no waste. In our soft water area, the lesser amount can be used. Good washing performance This set of sensitive washing soaps is perfectly good. It cleans well, it has a decent scent and they last. It's a fabric conditioner not a game changer. The hype attached to the scent of fabric conditioner is something as a family we ignore. All we want is for the clothes to smell fresh and pleasant after a wash, to be soft and comfortable to wear and for the product to be economical. Fortunately, this one fulfills all the criteria. When I say 'to smell fresh and pleasant' I don't mean stink the place out with the scent and overpower and wilt everything in a 100 yard radius. Again, fortunately, this doesn't do so and so gets a general thumbs up, but I could have done without the wording bigging up the wonderfulness of the smells. To me that's an alarm call not to purchase! I'll whisk myself away with my own favourite perfumes. I don't want my clothes having a big-smell life of their own!
Smells divine!! Smells gorgeous even if Ive dried them in the tumble. And great value for money if you do the subscription service.

Nice, gentle products that don't upset my family's eczema-prone skin These are gentle, skin-kind versions within the Persil and Comfort ranges. The bundled pack is a practical suggestion that offers good value compared to the individual retail prices of 2x25 wash Persil and 1x38 wash Comfort, making the fabric softener effectively free. I can't remember not using Persil non-biological as my laundry detergent of choice, it's the brand I grew up with - one that doesn't irritate the eczema and allergy prone skin of several members of my family. It has a pleasant, but not overly dominant scent, and the fluid formulation means this can be used even on cold washes. The Comfort is a highly concentrated version in quite a small bottle. In real life, the bottle is rather smaller than the product photo makes it appear in relation to the Persil, but this doesn't represent poor value (38 washes worth is 38 washes worth regardless of the size container in which it comes) and the small size does a good job of keeping the use of packaging materials down.
value for money good buy smells lush
Great value Value

I'm returning to the Persil non-bio fold. I used Persil non-bio for many years, but changed to a brand specifically for babies about eight years ago, so it was a bit of a homecoming using it again. I really like the flip-top opening and how smoothly the product pours into the dispenser ball, which is much easier than the crosscut design on my usual brand that requires a fair amount of pressure. I never had a problem with how well Persil cleans, and this hasnt changed; a machine load of baby clothes  together with stains - muslins and bedding came out spotless. With the addition of the Comfort Pure conditioner, the laundry was very soft and smelled lovely. It also performs well on general washing. I have decided to go back to using Persil non-bio; not just for the frustration-free dispenser, but it performs so well and is kind to skin. Using it again has made me wonder why I ever left the brand in the first place.

This bumper box is a good way to buy in bulk or go to your supermaket and look out for special offers! Highly recommended, this is the best conditioner we've tried!

A good-value bundle for sensitive skin, featuring two bottles of Persil and one of Comfort Although biological detergents are generally more effective than non-bio versions this version of Persil works well enough on babies wear and on normal soiling of the clothes of older people with sensitive skin. This handy pack includes two bottles of Persil non-bio liquid detergent (24 wash size) and one of Comfort Pure fabric conditioner (36 wash size) and is decent value at eleven pounds currently from Amazon. These two non-biological products are dermatologically tested and endorsed by the British Skin Foundation  they have been developed especially to be kind to sensitive baby skin. Good cleaning power for a non-biological washing detergent with soft and safe conditioning  well worth trying on your little one's clothes, or on your own if you have sensitive skin.

Concentrated Flowers Clearly this latest product variation from Comfort is to address some environmental concerns and plastics waste. The product is highly concentrated, so comes in a smaller bottle that is itself recycled. Reduced packaging and transport costs. All very commendable. Just how concentrated the product is can be sensed from the fact that you can detect the scent before you even open the bottle. When you do, don't breath deeply (as I did), it's overpowering. However, in it's more dilute form (just half a cap per load), it does add a pleasant, attractively "flowery" aroma to your clothes. All scents will be a matter of taste, but we like it and our washing feels soft and pleasant (though we were already regular Comfort users). In this form the product represents good value for a quality product and for those who want to lessen their impact on the environment (albeit in the smallest of ways), there's something for you here, too.

Sky fresh... I was a bit worried that a product called 'Intense' might leave an overpowering scent on your laundry, who wants to walk around smelling of fabric conditioner? Thankfully it's not like that at all and the scent it leaves is fresh and quite subtle (once dry) and lingers around without being too pervasive. The Fresh Sky fragrance is appealing and not too chemical-like with a fruity/floral mix. For me, it suits household items more than clothes, things like towels and bed linen are left softened and fresh-smelling. I appreciate the small bottle size and concentrated liquid and that it has less environmental impact but I do think that the concentrated liquids are less effective at softening than the more dilute liquids are. If you're looking for the best softening then consider a full-sized bottle but if you prefer a more subtle softening effect but the same fresh fragrance then this concentrated version is a great buy.

Doesn't just soften and scent the wash, but the whole house smells fresh and clean! I've not used a separate conditioner in years, because most washing products these days seem to do it all. I hadn't realised how much of a scent boost a separate fabric conditioner delivers, and how much it actually does soften the wash. The bottles - 6 of them, and not 8 as the ad states, come in a compact box and tbh, that itself could be used to deliver the products in, rather than having that placed in an Amazon box with more paper wrapping. All of the packaging, including the empty bottles, can be recycled. You don't waste any of the liquid, as the top of the bottle is well designed to minimise spillage and so that you can pour just what you need (half a capful is recommended, but I went with a little more), and not a gush of liquid from a large spout. I've had to dry indoors today due to the weather, and my whole house smells of this. I'm really impressed with this, and even for 6 bottles rather than the stated 8, this is good value for money. I also like that the small bottles mean that I can store them on a lower shelf for heavier items, rather than risking my under-sink shelving collapsing (yes, it's happened more than once!). Just don't squeeze the bottles hard, as they're made from recycled plastic and are a little flimsy-feeling.

Good value This is a more traditional scent from fabric conditioning experts Comfort. This 8 pack is highly concentrated, so you don't need to place much in the conditioner tray for it to be effective. The bottle is made from recycled plastic and itself can be recycled. A nice set of 8 bottles.

Nice fresh smell Comfort Intense has a nice fresh fragrance, although don't use more than recommended as it can be quite strong. The bottle is a nice size, easy for storing in a cupboard and although it looks small, you get a lot of washes out of the bottle. It does leave fabrics softer and is good for using with stuff you wash regularly like towels. Highly recommended!

Brings comfort to your clothes and your soul I love this product. It retains the quality one expects from the well known makers and leaves clothes feeling soft and smelling fresh. The concept of ultra concentrate isn't new as I recall they did one years ago in a tetra type pack. But now maybe public are ready for this innovation. The container is made from recycled plastic which is fantastic and refillable. It is also recyclable but the sleeve isn't which is a disappointment. I'm hoping the refill packs are from a more cardboard style pack though and fully recyclable. I'm glad it has a dose counter as it seems so much less to use it would be easy to put in too much if it wasn't there. My other half and I have sensitive skin and this was fine for us to use. I found it hard to read the small print on the wrapper even with magnification glass. But I couldn't see anything to say if it was tested on animals or if any animal products used in the making. Although this is not a food product these are issues that are important for many. Whilst it provides details of the headquarter offices it doesn't actually say where its produced, I think this would be helpful to know as for many people myself included would prefer to buy products made in country of sale to reduce carbon footprint. I am a little torn about this product as if it was a washing powder or liquid and comfort softener combination I can't help thinking that cuts down packaging and carbon footprint further and can be better value. However separate comfort softener such as this does make clothes smell lovely.
Well worth the money Washing my clothes

Good Softener This is a multi-pack of eight bottles of fabric softener. They are not the typical large sized bottles that I am used to, which is a bonus as they are cumbersome and tricky to store. Great cone. AWFUL ice cream Im a Coeliac and intolerant to cows milk, and have a huge sweet tooth. Ive found some amazing vegan ice cream alternatives. Ocado sell a number of delicious ones. I also LOVE Tescos gluten and dairy free Cornettos However was super excited to try these, especially after all the amazing reviews. The tops are covered in nuts and chocolate, and the cone is thick and crispy. However none of these bits are quite enough to hide the awful taste of the ice cream. I cant even describe it as bland, as it had a flavour.... just an awful one. It was not creamy and ice cream like. It was like frozen whipped up soya milk that they removed the flavour from. I enjoyed eating the chocolate and nut part and the cone, and just cringed my way through the ice cream part. Cant understand all the rave reviews. The vegan Magnums however are spot on and delicious!!!

Not as good as the ultra duo Very dissapointed in these capsules. The previous version, which was the Ultra, with only two compartments, was great because the capsules dissolved completely without leaving traces. These leave small white trails on dark clothes.

It's no cookies and cream but a welcome yum treat I was so excited to purchase this as I react to the usual dairy brands. The cone is lovely and the ice cream is nice enough to feel you are having a treat. It doesn't have the creamy feeling and texture of ice cream but near enough to eat and enjoy without any reaction! It's a little smaller than the full size cornetto but that's ok to keep the calories down. Would have liked the choc lump at the bottom of the cone. Already ordered my second box.
